text: JavaScript is a high-level programming language that follows the ECMAScript standard. It was originally designed as a scripting language for websites but became widely adopted as a general-purpose programming language, and is currently the most popular programming language in use. JavaScript is usually found running in a web browser as interactive or automated content, ranging from popup messages and live clocks to large web applications. JavaScript is also commonly used in server-side programming through platforms like Node.js, or "embedded" in non-JavaScript applications where the base programming language lacks the high-level functionality that JavaScript offers. Despite the similarities in name and syntax, JavaScript is not related to the programming language Java. Though the names of both languages are trademarks of Oracle Corporation, the two languages follow different design principles, and are actively developed by unrelated organizations. _Object Model_ window (Global Object) │ ├── BOM (Browser Object Model) │ ├── location │ │ ├── href │ │ ├── hostname │ │ ├── pathname │ │ ├── protocol │ │ ├── assign() │ │ ├── reload() │ │ └── replace() │ │ │ ├── navigator │ │ ├── userAgent │ │ ├── language │ │ ├── platform │ │ └── geolocation │ │ │ ├── history │ │ ├── length │ │ ├── back() │ │ ├── forward() │ │ └── go() │ │ │ ├── screen │ │ ├── width │ │ ├── height │ │ ├── availWidth │ │ └── availHeight │ │ │ ├── console │ │ ├── log() │ │ ├── error() │ │ ├── warn() │ │ └── info() │ │ │ ├── alert() │ ├── prompt() │ ├── confirm() │ ├── open() │ └── close() │ ├── DOM (Document Object Model) │ ├── document │ │ ├── documentElement () ← Root of DOM │ │ │ ├── head (
